Other Information.Test Conditions: Varied temperatures, up to 7296 degrees of freedom considered
Other Information.Additional Info: Quantum effects like zero-point energy dominate; tunneling contributes to normal kinetic isotope effect but is outweighed by ZPE.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Varied temperatures, up to 7296 degrees of freedom considered
Other Information.Additional Info: Deuterium exhibits smaller zero-point energy, leading to inverse kinetic isotope effect at low temperatures.

Sieving Mechanism: Quantum sieving based on zero-point energy and tunneling

Experimental Validation.Method: Canonical variational theory with small-curvature tunneling (CVT/SCT)
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: KIE (kinetic isotope effect) peaks at 13 at 65 K for H2/D2 separation

Other Information.Additional Info: Quantum effects are significant at low temperatures; classical simulations overestimate diffusion rates.
